intro: Crinitaria cretica, commonly known as the Canary Island pine, is a species of pine native to the Canary Islands. It is characterized by its tall, slender trunk and long, drooping branches that give it a distinctive appearance. The plant has needle-like leaves that are typically dark green and arranged in bundles of five. It produces small, reddish-brown cones that contain its seeds. This evergreen tree is adapted to the dry, coastal climates of its native habitat.
